tweet: Congratulations to the Ferdinand Branstetter @AmericanLegion Post in Van Tassell on their 100th anniversary celebration! Not only is this post the first in Wyoming but one of the first posts in the U.S. I am proud of this institution and would like to thank all who have served.

He has a passion for our nation’s public lands and a deep understanding of issues facing Fish and Wildlife Service and the National Park Service. I am confident he will serve the department and our country well.

His experience as a seasonal ranger in Grand Teton National Park, prior service as assistant director of the National Park Service and extensive record of leadership will lend well to this new position.

I am glad the Senate confirmed Rob Wallace to be the assistant secretary for Fish, Wildlife, and Parks at @Interior. I’ve known Rob for many years and know that he is extremely qualified for this important position. pic.twitter.com/DXSQax6bpC

I'm glad the Senate passed a defense bill today that prioritizes quality of life for our troops and their families as well as modernizing technologies and strengthening our alliances. Introduced legislation with @SenatorBennet that would help to ensure drug labels for older treatments are kept up-to-date so consumers have a better understanding of the prescription drugs they take. https://www.enzi.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/enzi-bennet-introduce-bill-to-update-prescription-drug-labels …

I’m glad the Supreme Court ruled 7-2 allowing a World War I memorial to remain standing in Maryland. Last year I joined 108 of my colleagues in signing an amicus brief to express my support of the Bladensburg Peace Cross. https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/supreme-court-upholds-cross-on-public-land-in-maryland/2019/06/20/15a99b4c-9367-11e9-956a-88c291ab5c38_story.html?utm_term=.48ee2bea7ab2 …

It was wonderful to have Wyoming Senator Eli Bebout testify at a Budget Committee hearing to explore the advantages of our state’s budgeting process. The committee also passed our Grant Reporting Efficiency and Agreements Transparency (GREAT) Act, which would simplify the federal government’s grant process and increase transparency to help keep track of federal dollars. https://bit.ly/2IsD2z9

Gov shutdowns hurt hardworking Americans & Congress should not be exempt. I supported @SenatorLankford's Government Shutdown Accountability Act today, which would put restrictions on members of Congress until they pass all 12 funding bills. States, not the federal government, are in the best position to set energy policies that work best for them. This rule helps to empower states and provide needed flexibility to move toward better energy production without causing economic harm.

This bipartisan bill makes important changes to the IRS and will require the IRS to notify the public before closing Taxpayer Assistance Centers, an action I sought after the Cheyenne center closed.

I’m glad the Senate unanimously passed the Taxpayer First Act to protect hardworking taxpayers. https://www.enzi.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/senate-unanimously-passes-taxpayer-first-act-to-reform-and-improve-irs …

Back in 1777, our country chose the stars and stripes to represent our nation. Today, our flag is a symbol across the world for freedom. #FlagDay reminds us of our American values and to always work hard and follow your dreams. Happy Flag Day! pic.twitter.com/HOy8Fo253A

Grant reporting can be inefficient and overly complex. I sent a letter to @SBAgov to help ensure that the HUBZone program is fulfilling its mission & improving economic opportunities in distressed communities. In Wyoming, there are HUBZones in eight of our counties and the Wind River Reservation. https://www.enzi.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/enzi-works-to-ensure-hubzone-program-is-improving-economic-opportunities …

A recent @WashingtonPost article showed that the Historically Underutilized Business Zones (HUBZone) program funds are going to some of the nation’s wealthiest areas, instead of spurring economic development in the country’s neediest communities. https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/a-federal-program-was-established-to-help-disadvantaged-areas-thats-not-where-most-of-the-money-goes/2019/04/25/c0bae5c2-f411-11e8-80d0-f7e1948d55f4_story.html?utm_term=.f967d00584a7 …

100 years ago, the Senate passed the 19th amendment recognizing the right of ALL women across the country to vote. Wyoming helped lead this movement as the first territory to grant women the right to vote 50 years prior. We honor those who fought for all women to have this right.
